scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Liviu
scrape.text: This is a book that is written well and it is quite absorbing, while its controversial nature is more of a reflection of the conflict between the contemporary pc values and human nature than anything else as the decisions taken by the narrator and his wife would be quite uncontroversial in earlier times when family was paramount.The other point I think the book drives well home (intentionally or not) is how today's world is quite fragile and beneath the civilized facade lurk the ancient demons, but that's a point that survivors of the attempt to create the "new human" during the last century collectivist dictatorships know very well, even if the contemporary trends towards collectivism in Europe tends to mask it beneath pc rhetoric, of course until prosperity breaks down and the ancient demons resurface
